programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss's judgement is called into question and Darrell lays his hands on a timeless unit in Azusa. Jarrod insists it is quality that matters, not quantity.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey must decide if an original Casablanca movie poster is worth the six figures it will take to secure a deal. The work of Las Vegas pawnbrokers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The greatest treasures and biggest disappointments in Pawn Star history, including a violin with million-dollar potential and a document signed by John Hancock.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With over 40,000 wristbands to sell, stored in 126 boxes, Les decides to sell them one by one, starting at $2 apiece. Seth and Ashley remain sceptical of the idea.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley make a series of bets to see if they or Les can purchase any item that comes into the store that they would otherwise dismiss as 'junk'.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick focuses his attentions on a replica fighter jet after receiving a call from an air force base, while the team works on a blacksmith's forge.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A client hires the team to restore a peanut roaster, and Ron buys a vintage English taxi.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.desc: Detectives recall how they caught the killer of 29-year-old Vitalija Baliutaviciene, who died after being kidnapped on her way to work in Peterborough in 2011.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: How, after a night out, a young woman ended up in a shallow grave. Her killer managed to evade police for decades.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An English bidder turns up at Fort Worth. Victor acquires some spy equipment, while Ricky and Bubba have their eyes on something far more dangerous.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba plan to get revenge on a rival at an auction in Dallas, and arguments erupt surrounding a musical instrument.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts unseal the truth about the potential aliens living and working among humans.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts investigate the mystery of the Solway Firth Spaceman - a spacesuit-cladded figure who appeared in a photograph taken in Cumbria.

programme.title: Ultimate Vehicles
programme.desc: The milestones of engineering that have changed transport by train, looking at the most spectacular vehicles to have ever travelled on rail.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank and Mike need to make a perfect purchase to justify their long journey - and an embalming table with a fascinating history might be what they are looking for.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz explore a warehouse belonging to country musician Mickey Gilley, and find a sign used in the movie Urban Cowboy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: After Seth rescinds his invasive search policies for his employees, the women to return to work. The leader soon wrestles with a new problem - profits are down, so he looks at creative ways to get new customers into the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The staff receive complaints from customers that a staff member has been letting customers cut in line in exchange for a tip. They later find out that Anton, who works the pawn desk, is responsible.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth swaps the workstations for two members of his team. However, Les becomes angered at the situation, feeling that the arrangement was good enough in the first place.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Jeff calls in sick, leading to Seth to order everyone to stay away from his desk in any circumstances. He then finds Bobby J in the banned area, polishing a ring for a customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les sells a valuable Breitling watch for $42,000 to a trusted watch collector that he dealt with many times before. His customer does not have the funds, so Les gives him the merchandise in exchange for an IOU. Seth has grave misgivings about the deal, but Les still has trust in the customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a deal to get the others off his back, but when some interesting animals come through the door, it might be too much for him to resist.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team are all about cutting deals, but it remains to be seen what happens when Chum takes a stab at three Japanese Samurai swords.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 18th-century Tryal of Witches book is brought to the shop, as well as a gold-plated banjo, and the guys check out the restored car from Wayne's World.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a warm-up jersey signed by Kobe Bryant. Then, he has an axe to grind over a seller's asking price for an antique weapon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team examines a 1973 Marshall Amp, and a hover-board from the movie Back to the Future Part II, signed by the cast.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Potential money-spinners include gold and silver coins, tax stamps, an album signed by Bob Marley, and a vintage Win-a-Card game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts assess an ancient coin, and an autographed movie poster for the movie Reservoir Dogs.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey must decide if an original Casablanca movie poster is worth the six figures it will take to secure a deal. The work of Las Vegas pawnbrokers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The greatest treasures and biggest disappointments in Pawn Star history, including a violin with million-dollar potential and a document signed by John Hancock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: After test-driving the infamous OJ Simpson Bronco, Rick Harrison must decide whether to purchase this million-dollar item. Plus, a rare silverware set and a 1978 Star Wars comic come under consideration.

programme.title: Mega Pit Stops
programme.desc: A look at how enormous vehicles, such as planes, trains and ships, are repaired and returned to service within incredibly short timeframe.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: A Haunted Antique Store and More
programme.desc: The stories of a UFO spotted over Inner Mongolia, a poltergeist haunting a British antique shop and a father and son who claimed to have encountered Bigfoot in Washington.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts try to solve paranormal phenomena, looking at the Bermuda Triangle in the hope they can determine what has caused ships and planes to disappear.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Marty and Rick Lagina and the team make a huge breakthrough as they decide to focus their efforts on a mysterious, triangle-shaped swamp.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: A fast turnaround order forces Dwayne and his team to deliver twice as quickly as usual. Despite the divers' relentless work ethic, they are met with a huge surprise back at port.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies are joined by Aisling Bea, Lee Mack, Jason Manford to answer questions on the subject of peril. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Rhod Gilbert, Jamie Laing, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Claudia Winkleman, who aim to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Angela Barnes, Miles Jupp, Romesh Ranganathan and Josh Widdicombe on the comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on major news stories from June 2014 and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, actor Tom Davis, actor and musician Shaun Ryder and comedian Henning Wehn, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: A therapist is convinced that Josh has been infatuated with her for a long time, while Kate tries to get her photography career off the ground.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Shappi Khorsandi, former newsreader Michael Buerk, actress Amanda Abbington and comedian Elis James take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games. Their scores are tallied from across the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: With the amulet seemingly out of reach, a new opportunity to get home comes Brian's way when a fire sprite unexpectedly grants him a wish.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Adventurers Tim and Gendle are given an epic downhill location and three days to pull off a spectacular festival of drift.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hurricane Man
programme.desc: Josh takes his British documentary team into their first typhoon, and his novice chasers face a twin threat from Typhoon Soulik, and hot on its heels - Typhoon Cimaron.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The gang is on Barry and Darren's home turf in Reading, Berkshire, where the pair are determined not to leave empty-handed. Meanwhile, Dan takes a gamble.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees Hampshire bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank finally get access to their white whale pick, while in Texas, the guys meet a collector who has filled an entire town with his mammoth stockpile.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, reflecting the daily challenges of combating crime and revealing fresh insights into modern policing.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Following a successful pilot scheme trailing the use of body cameras, Staffordshire Police officers are now wearing them on patrol to increase transparency and bring offenders to justice. The series provides a hard-hitting mixture of bodycam and observational footage, reflecting the daily challenges of combating crime and revealing fresh insights into the fast-paced world of modern policing.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, revealing what makes its officers tick, how they deal with the tragedies they inevitably have to face and how much they rely on each other and also their camaraderie.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: People forced out of their homes in Honduras by the notorious MS-13 gang plead their case for asylum in America. Officers discover 3,000lb of marijuana hidden in a cargo truck.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch's Mercedes X-Class pick-up sets a benchmark on a high-speed rock crawl. Then, in just four days, engineer Ralph Hosier and his two teams of car enthusiasts must find a way to out-engineer a slice of precision German technology.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer finally tires of being embarrassed by his fellow crewmen, and decides to take his revenge by forcing them to spend 12 weeks in strict quarantine after they are exposed to a deadly virus. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: An experiment with a machine that can make duplicates of an object goes wrong and crew members are aghast to encounter their evil 'doppelgangers'.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Starbug crashes while trying to evade a giant squid, but instead of dying the crew members discover all their memories of their time on Red Dwarf had been generated by a video game - one they had been playing extremely badly. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn, with guest star Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: The will-they-won't-they tension between Lee and Lucy reaches unseen new highs in this epic finale for Christmas. Sally Bretton, Bobby Ball and Katy Wix co-star.

programme.title: Man on Fire (2004)
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with alcoholism is hired as a bodyguard to the daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City - but when the girl is abducted, he swears to exact an explosive revenge on the kidnappers. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning.

programme.title: Monster Ships
programme.desc: Travelling continually as a transport conveyor, Thermopylae is a vital delivery service with companies all over the world depending on her speed, efficiency and reliability.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: An insight into the construction of the cutting-edge Ford class aircraft carriers, the largest warships ever built, which are almost as long as the Empire State Building is tall.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Surviving Alcatraz: Escaping the Rock
programme.desc: Scientists investigate a 1962 breakout from the island prison, to determine whether the escapees drowned while fleeing in a makeshift raft or if they safely made it to the mainland.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of tending the fire of a steam locomotive on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she stokes the bolier of NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At South Devon, engineer Ray Lee is working to bring a loco back in to service. There is also a visit to the SS Kingswear paddle steamer In Dartmouth, the oldest vessel of its kind.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, trainee Claire Oates takes her driving test, while chef Alex and manager Michelle prepare a dinner for 130 people on the East Lancashire railway.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: The late 1960s saw the first regular transmission of colour television, and the music world followed the trend with the launch of BBC television show Colour Me Pop. This episode features some of the programme's highlights, including performances by the Who, the Kinks, the Small Faces, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Celebration of the supergroups and guitar heroes to emerge toward the end of the decade, including Pink Floyd, the Rolling Stones, Fleetwood Mac and Jimi Hendrix.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performance from the decade, featuring the Who, Queen, David Bowie, the Moody Blues, the Rolling Stones and Elton John.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performances from the decade, featuring Aretha Franklin, Bill Withers, Rose Royce, the Real Thing and Michael Jackson.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the somewhat macabre history of Scotland Yard, and revealing the lesser-known facts about one of the world's most famous police stations.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the Chteau de Fontainebleau in France, which began life as a medieval castle in the 12th century before being turned into a renaissance palace in the 1500s.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: An audacious killer taunts the members of Glasgow CID by bumping off the owner of the hotel where their annual dinner is being held - while proceedings are in full swing and the place is full of off-duty detectives. Drama, starring James MacPherson and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh arrests a man accused of deliberately infecting women with HIV, but Leela reckons her colleague is prejudiced against the colour of the suspect's skin - and when she learns Sheelagh was demoted to PC because of a racism allegation, it seems her worst fears are confirmed. Jim is appalled when his ex-wife's decomposing body is found, and Neil is faced with hard evidence of his father-in-law's fondness for rent boys.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch team is called to deal with a barn fire that has started out in the Kent countryside. As the crew tries to get the raging blaze under control it discovers that fire-fighting is a far more difficult process with the limited resources it has outside of London.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The monks cause a storm of resentment by launching an expedition to a Welsh village to recover the bones of St Winifred and return them to the abbey. As if that does not make them unpopular enough, a local landowner dies in mysterious circumstances and it is up to Brother Cadfael to clear his colleagues of murder and ensure they get out of the country alive. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Michael Culver, John Hallam and Anna Friel.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: The Black Virgin of Vladimir - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. An American acquaintance of Lovejoy's is sold some fake antiques, so he sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible - and make a little money into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: The Black Virgin of Vladimir - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lovejoy sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible for deceiving his American acquaintance - and make a little money for himself into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: The treacherous Major Brand attempts to dupe Sharpe into helping him betray Ross to the French, while back behind British lines Jane has to deal with the amorous advances of a poet. Sean Bean stars, with Daragh O'Malley, Mark Strong and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz falls in love with a German girl, and plans to marry her - and the fact he has a wife and son back home seems to be of little concern. Jimmy Nail stars.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Dennis's wife Vera announces she is coming across to Germany, casting a shadow over the future of his developing relationship with Dagmar. Meanwhile, Oz contemplates the power of reincarnation, and Wayne falls in love. Tim Healy, Jimmy Nail and Gary Holten star.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Part two of two. Peregrine convinces Eric to come clean about a past crime that will clear his name for the murders, and Violetta's hidden musical talents put her and Peregrine in grave danger. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the murder of a B-movie director when the production of Demon Brides comes to Kembleford. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Sid falls for the heiress to a local brewery, only for her to be arrested for the murder of her own father. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Jared discovers a severed human hand in a crayfish pot, begging the questions who does it belong to and are they still alive? Detective drama, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When a French diplomat to a secret international meeting is found dead, Murdoch is drafted in to temporarily impersonate him - but political and sexual intrigue complicate matters.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: A drug dealer dies while in police custody and Sam suspects a cover-up within the unit. He orders a full investigation, though it seems none of the other officers is prepared to help. To Gene's relief, the pathologist's report appears to put everyone in the clear, but when the truth about the criminal's demise emerges, it is up to the 21st-century cop to decide whether to reveal it. John Simm and Philip Glenister star.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of a bookies' clerk leads the team to 29-year-old Vic Tyler - who Sam is shocked to discover is his own father. He realises the time when he and his mother were abandoned is coming up and desperately tries to persuade the small-time gambler not to leave his wife and child. Meanwhile, Gene sees an opportunity to bring down a crime syndicate.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The old poem about the boy standing on the burning deck takes on new meaning as Kavanagh defends two Navy officers accused of arson, and finds he cannot use his only defence. It is a tough case, and the last thing he needs is extra stress at home - but that does not stop the children planning an anniversary party without telling him. With Andy Serkis, Ray Winstone and Geraldine James.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Pledge
programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Conman: The Life and Crimes of Mark Acklom
programme.desc: Documentary following the story of a cunning fraudster who posed as an MI6 agent to con his ex-girlfriend out of almost 300,000

programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners take to the arena once more, performing routines based on a selection of different dance style. Kevin Kilbane won't be among them, having lost out in last week's skate-off to H. Which of tonight's celebrities will find themselves in the bottom two? Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on a BMX champion at the UK's national cycling centre. Can he win the race or will he get the cream pie forfeit?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Spike falls in love with a french poodle, who is actually friends with Tom.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A set of kittens inside a knight's armor create havoc for Tom and Jerry in a haunted castle.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands that Bean stay in to take delivery of a new lounge chair. He is forced to dress up as Mrs. Wicket to make sure it is delivered!.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Part one of two. International Rescue faces their most dangerous mission ever when Tracy Island comes under attack. Guest starring Lee Majors (The Six Million Dollar Man).

credits.actor: Lee Majors (The Six Million Dollar Man)

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Fast Show star Arabella Weir, top chefs Lisa Goodwin-Allen and Mark Sargeant, and horticultural expert David Domoney, who will be talking about the launch of ITV's Veg Power campaign.

programme.title: Gary Rhodes: The First Rock Star Chef
programme.desc: Documentary paying tribute to the celebrity chef who died in 2019, exploring his impact on both British food and television and showcasing footage from an incomplete final series. Featuring contributions from friends and family, including Gordon Ramsay, Tom Kerridge, Alex Ferguson, and Gary's sons, George and Sam.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: The British love chocolate, so Sian Williams investigates what makes it so irresistible and gets the public tucking into theCadbury's chocolate bar with 30 per cent less sugar to see if it as tasty as it is healthy. Two more diets are also put to the test - the Meal Prepping for Weight-loss Diet, in which calorie-counted meals are all prepared in advance, and the Diabetes Weight-loss cookbook, road-tested by a woman who is borderline type 2 diabetic.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Ascot
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Oli Bell present coverage of the 3.35 Betfair Ascot Steeple Chase, which follows races at 1.50, 2.25 and 3.00. Plus, races from 2.05 and 3.15 at Haydock Park, and 2.45 at Wincanton. With analysis from AP McCoy and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Luke Harvey, Rishi Persad and Alice Plunkett, betting news from Matt Chapman, and commentary by Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the show's most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shepherd, in which the the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Sing (2016)
programme.desc: A theatre-owning koala sets up a singing competition in a last-ditch bid to stay afloat. Animation, with the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon, Seth MacFarlane and Scarlett Johansson.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the grand final of the singing contest. Only three of the show's famous contestants have kept their identity a secret, and tonight, these three finalists will be competing for the series trophy before all of them are unmasked. Regular panellists Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong will have one last chance to guess the famous faces hidden behind the bizarre costumes, before all 12 of the show's performers take to the stage together for a special group performance.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the penultimate round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' will.i.am,Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Meghan Trainor seek out the nation's best vocal talent. The coveted spaces on the coaches' teams are filling up and as ever, there is a simple twist to the auditions - with the four coaches selecting their teams without being able to see them, looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: Rocky Balboa (2006)
programme.desc: The ageing fighter contemplates a return to the ring when a computer simulation reveals he would have defeated the current world heavyweight champion Mason 'The Line' Dixon, who responds by challenging Rocky to face him for real. Boxing drama sequel, directed by and starring Sylvester Stallone. With Antonio Tarver, Geraldine Hughes, Burt Young, Milo Ventimiglia and Tony Burton.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production processes of non-alcoholic beers, heavy-duty cars able to negotiate rocks and boulders, escalators and lie detectors.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike tracks down a Lincoln Continental, which set new style standards for luxury sedans in the 1960s. However, tastes have changed, and Edd hatches a refurb plan.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini hits the jackpot when after finding a 1970 Porsche 911 E Targa with low mileage, he secures a near-mint condition 1962 Jaguar Mark 2 3.8 saloon and an unrestored 1932 Stutz DV32 convertible.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini sets out to find a specific Volvo 960 station wagon. Original owner, actor Paul Newman, fitted this car with a supercharged 5.0 litre V8 engine from a Ford Mustang.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team heads to Hunter Mountain for fun and games on the slopes, while the bike set for auction is sent to be painted and powder-coated.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: A 1917 Overland becomes FantomWorks' oldest restoration, while Dan buys a 1968 Camaro on the internet and decides to build it as a present for his wife.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.sub-title: Dirty Jobs of the Big Apple
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to New York, where he experiences life working alongside an elevator repairman.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind cheese graters, silver jewellery and traditional Mexican chairs.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How game calls, mayonnaise and different types of razors are manufactured.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Part two of two. A typhoon puts livelihoods on the line, with rookie skipper Josh Harris's weaknesses exposed and Captain Sig's control of the Northwestern in jeopardy.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini visits a local farm to examine a Studebaker, and later discovers a 922 Martin motorbike and sidecar.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Renault Alpine 310 in France, but mechanic Edd China finds the car holds some surprises when he tries to fix it up.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a 56-year-old Citroen 2CV in the south of France. However, with age comes problems, and expert mechanic Edd China needs to strip it back to its bare bones to breathe new life into the vehicle, as almost every aspect of the quirky car requires attention.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Automobile enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China begin restoring an old Peugeot 205 on a tight budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China continue their project to make a second-hand Peugeot 205 roadworthy again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes to France in search of a retro Citroen HY Van, but mechanic Edd China is not impressed with his spoils, knowing it will be a costly renovation.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Chopped
programme.desc: Car dealer Mike Brewer is ecstatic when he gets a cult VW Corrado coupe with only one previous owner for a bargain price. However, with cheap cars come expensive surprises.

programme.title: Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: The quarter-finals on day five from Cardiff.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day six at the Motorpoint Arena in Cardiff, featuring the opening semi-final.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: The team investigates a secret U-Boat docking station that could have aided Hitler's escape from Europe, and discover a sunken sub near Caleta de Loros.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A deadly caiman targets Mehgan, and a potentially crippling accident leads to a shocking find - a coded message from the past that may bring the prospectors closer to gold.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys an old Lancia Delta Integrale, enlisting Edd China to fix the brakes and change the battery.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Chopped
programme.desc: Car dealer Mike Brewer takes a chance by buying a late Alfasud 1.5 TI at auction. With no service history, dodgy brakes, and clapped out suspension, mechanic Edd China sets out to work his magic.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day six at the Motorpoint Arena in Cardiff, featuring the second semi-final.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Leeds United v Bristol City and West Bromwich Albion v Nottingham Forest.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: New team the Bushmen clash with opal thieves raiding one of their mines. The Cookes hack an old digging machine, while the Fire Crew hunt for a new deposit of rare black opal.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The murder of John Proctor, by his neice Susan Warne. When the seemingly healthy 80-year-old was found dead at home, police were stumped. But, Warne was hiding a dark secret that lead to his death.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators dispute the innocence of teens supposedly involved in murders.

programme.title: The Murder Tapes
programme.desc: When Brad McGarry was found murdered in his Ohio basement, detectives suspected robbery. However, a friend led them to someone whom they least expected..

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The shotgun murders of John and Carolyn Tarwacki. When John Tarwacki Sr discovered the bodies of his son and daughter-in-law in February 2010, the only story told at the scene was found in the snow. Boot prints revealed the path the killer had taken, but the search for a motive led police in a startling direction.

programme.title: Pamela Smart: An American Murder Mystery
programme.desc: The presenter revisits the case of 24-year-old Gregg Smart, found murdered in the entrance to his condo. Investigators arrested three teens with connections to his wife.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A retriever is found trapped in a drainpipe, having been there for more than 12 hours after taking shelter from storms.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: It is the turn of the Cook Islands to provide the cases, as Chris Brown handles a hit-and-run victim, a wolfhound with an eye problem and very mischievous goat called Brownie.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The crew meets a celebrity designer and a bride-to-be who wants a wedding dress painted on her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is more concerned with pleasing her mother than herself, while another customer has no idea what style of dress she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: David helps a bride recovering from a brain illness who suffers a lack of confidence over the weight she has gained, while another customer clashes with her mother.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris takes us into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets. A labrador is brought in with bulging eyeballs, and 60-year-old tortoise Hugo needs a mate.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Vet Lisa treats a cat badly injured in a hit-and-run, Chris devises a radical treatment for a bird and Pearl the blind seal undergoes a risky operation to restore her sight.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.sub-title: Steven and Justin's Story - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Steven weighs 800lbs and his brother Justin 600lbs. Desperate to save both his sons' lives, their father travels across the US to seek help.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Chad undergoes gastric bypass surgery and quickly loses weight - but he risks his life by not following his doctor's instructions.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman who married a man attracted to overweight women needed to undergo surgery, and now faces making a fresh start in her life.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 19-year-old Logan Schiendelman, who vanished after a night out. When authorities found no evidence of foul play, they were forced to examine his family's controversial past.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Shaundalyn seeks a sexy look for her big day, despite her conservative friend's approval, while Ashley is looking for a glam dress, but her sassy grandmother has other ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Ashley's appointment is placed in jeopardy by her mother's antics, while Kellie hopes dress-shopping will mend her difficult relationship with her mum.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Leah seeks a modern-style wedding gown, complete with pockets, but her sassy grandmother has a more traditional dress in mind.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Tameria wants to wear a simple dress, but members of her fashion-forward family has other ideas. Hailey puts aside her sexy dress vision to please her future mother-in law.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: After spending her youth in outfits covered in bling, Emily wants to wear a traditional gown on her big day. Fashionista Diana is looking for a strapless gown, but her mother has other ideas. At her fitting, Jackie is still looking for her mother's approval.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Donnetta brings 12 friends to help her find a dress that puts her in the spotlight, though her unruly group threatens to silence her own voice. Meanwhile, another customer looks for a gown that will show off her figure.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Jenee has every detail set for her big day - except for the dress. Country girl, Jessica has a specific vision in mind for her gown, though her sister-in-law's city taste could stand in the way. At her fitting, Leslie is still looking for her mother's approval.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Featuring a woman who is getting married on the stage at a concert, and a virgin bride visiting the salon for the first time.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa undergoes a mammogram that yields some troubling results, and a fashion designer Carson Kressley receives a reading.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo runs a group reading for people in law enforcement and reunites a man with the son who was accidentally shot. However, she has to cancel a reading for the first time in six years while waiting for her biopsy results.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.sub-title: You Are Gonna Die in Here
programme.desc: Wayne's life changed when he was the target of a school shooting. Now struggling with post-traumatic stress disorder and compulsive hoarding, his family fears for his well-being.

programme.title: People Magazine Investigates
programme.desc: An instance in which a fire chief's wife was found burnt to death in her home. An autopsy revealed the cause of death as a gunshot to the head, shocking a small Louisiana town.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Ben Butler, who killed his young daughter Ellie while in a rage. Along with his wife, former EastEnders actress Jennie Gray, he faked the detailed he passed in an emergency services call and later protested innocence.

programme.title: In Memoriam
programme.desc: Wounded survivors, grieving relatives and heroes from three mass shootings in the US relive the moment their lives changed for ever, revealing the emotional scars they left..
